intro: Cambessedesia uncinata, commonly known as the hooked cambessedesia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hairy seeds. Cambessedesia uncinata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
